title: QAnon
deleted: On September 9, 2019, Trump retweeted a video from the QAnon-promoting [[Twitter]] account "The Dirty Truth". The video featured future [[Director of National Intelligence]] [[John Ratcliffe (American politician)|John Ratcliffe]] criticizing former [[FBI]] director [[James Comey]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Embury-Dennis |first=Tom |date=September 9, 2019 |title=Trump launches furious yet confused attack on rival's affair with 'flaming dancer' after promoting QAnon conspiracy theorist |language=en |work=[[The Independent]] |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/trump-tweet-qanon-mark-sanford-affair-republican-president-2020-election-a9097461.html |access-date=April 17, 2020}}</ref> Shortly after Christmas 2019, Trump retweeted over one dozen QAnon followers.<ref>{{Cite news |date=December 28, 2019 |title=Trump retweets a post naming the alleged whistleblower |work=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-retweets--then-deletes--a-post-naming-the-alleged-whistleblower/2019/12/28/aa518350-2989-11ea-9c21-2c2a4d2c2166_story.html}}</ref>

title: QAnon
deleted: In July 2020, the media watchdog [[Media Matters]] reported that [[Chanel Rion]]—the chief White House correspondent for the [[One America News Network]]—had appeared on a QAnon streaming program and asserted Q's existence, saying, "Q is anonymous for a reason, for a very good reason, and I think that people need to respect that."<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hananoki |first=Eric |date=July 15, 2020 |title=OAN's Chanel Rion made pro-QAnon remarks on a QAnon program |url=https://www.mediamatters.org/one-america-news-network/oans-chanel-rion-made-pro-qanon-remarks-qanon-program |website=Media Matters for America}}</ref>

title: QAnon
added: In 2019, Twitter removed accounts suspected of being connected to the Russian [[Internet Research Agency]] which had disseminated a high volume of tweets related to #QAnon and using the #WWG1WGA slogan.<ref name="Reuters20200824" />

title: QAnon
deleted: *{{Cite news |last=Stanley-Becker |first=Isaac |date=August 2, 2020 |title=How the Trump campaign came to court QAnon, the online conspiracy movement identified by the FBI as a violent threat |language=en |work=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/how-the-trump-campaign-came-to-court-qanon-the-online-conspiracy-movement-identified-by-the-fbi-as-a-violent-threat/2020/08/01/dd0ea9b4-d1d4-11ea-9038-af089b63ac21_story.html}}

title: QAnon
added: His son, [[Eric Trump]], in a Summer 2020 tweet later deleted, promoted his father's rally in Tulsa with an image of a large "Q" and the WWGOWGA slogan.<ref name="WaPo20200802">{{Cite news|last=Stanley-Becker|first=Isaac|date=August 2, 2020|access-date=October 4, 2020|title=How the Trump campaign came to court QAnon, the online conspiracy movement identified by the FBI as a violent threat|work=The Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/how-the-trump-campaign-came-to-court-qanon-the-online-conspiracy-movement-identified-by-the-fbi-as-a-violent-threat/2020/08/01/dd0ea9b4-d1d4-11ea-9038-af089b63ac21_story.html}}</ref>

title: QAnon
deleted: *{{Cite news |last=Bump |first=Philip |date=August 1, 2018 |title=Why the QAnon conspiracy is the natural culmination of the Trump era |language=en |work=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/politics/wp/2018/08/01/why-the-qanon-conspiracy-is-the-natural-culmination-of-the-trump-era/ |issn=0190-8286}}

title: QAnon
added: In September 2020, politicial newcomer Lauren Witzke defeated another candidate endorsed by the Republican party to become the GOP's nominee for senate in Delaware. Witzke had previously promoted QAnon on Twitter and had been photographed wearing a Q t-shirt, although during the campaign she distanced herself from the movement. She had also called herself a "flat-earther" and in September called her Democratic opponent [[Chris Coons]] a "Christian-hating baby-killer," adding, "I’m coming for your seat, Satanist."<ref>https://www.chicagotribune.com/election-2020/ct-lauren-witzke-delaware-qanon-flat-earth-20200917-w6xeptfn65bqrj4tzv75oygnoa-story.html</ref><ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/04/us/politics/biden-republicans-delaware.html</ref>

title: QAnon
added: In September 2020, politicial newcomer Lauren Witzke defeated another candidate endorsed by the Republican party to become the GOP's nominee for senate in Delaware. Witzke had previously promoted QAnon on Twitter and had been photographed wearing a Q t-shirt, although during the campaign she distanced herself from the movement. She had also called herself a "flat-earther" and in September called her Democratic opponent [[Chris Coons]] a "Christian-hating baby-killer," adding, "I’m coming for your seat, Satanist."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/election-2020/ct-lauren-witzke-delaware-qanon-flat-earth-20200917-w6xeptfn65bqrj4tzv75oygnoa-story.html|title=Republican nominee for US Senate in Delaware has repeatedly promoted QAnon conspiracy theory, once called self ‘flat earther’|first=RANDALL|last=CHASE|website=chicagotribune.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/04/us/politics/biden-republicans-delaware.html|title=In Biden’s Home State, Republican Centrism Gives Way to the Fringe|first=Elizabeth|last=Williamson|date=October 4, 2020|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>

title: QAnon
added: By 2020 and exacerbated by the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], QAnon conspiracy theories spread into Europe, particularly in Germany. Spread by far-right activists and influencers, the German audience for QAnon on YouTube, Facebook, and Telegram is estimated at 200,000. <!--could talk about why but perhaps best suited for the analysis section?-->Protests in 20 British towns and cities tended to be less right-wing and female in demographic.<ref>{{Cite news |last1=Bennhold |first1=Katrin |title=QAnon Is Thriving in Germany. The Extreme Right Is Delighted. |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=2020-10-11 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/11/world/europe/qanon-is-thriving-in-germany-the-extreme-right-is-delighted.html |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><!-- more to paraphrase in source -->
